description: From Ancient Greek ἀντανάκλασις (antanáklasis, “reflection, bending back”), from ἀντί (antí, “against”) + ἀνά (aná, “up”) + κλάσις (klásis, “breaking”).

entries.meaning: (rhetoric) The repeated use of the same word or phrase, but with a different meaning each time; a kind of paronomasia.
